body.p: I am most unfortunate in the filling-up of that important blankIn connection with an appeal, which CD had decided to support, to the Literary Fund on behalf of Wilmington Fleming. See To Wilmington Fleming, [?24] October [1838], Pilgrim Letters 1, p. 444. in your kind note. For on Wednesday the 21st I preside at the public dinner of the Newsvenders’Thus in MS. Benevolent Institution,Newsvendors’ Benevolent Institution, a charity founded in 1839 in support of workers in the newspaper industry. CD was president from 1854 until his death in 1870. and (for that day) there is no other hope in me.
